proj78.xml
Class XmlDocument

java.lang.Object
  proj78.xml.XmlNode
      proj78.xml.XmlParentNode
          proj78.xml.XmlDocument

public class XmlDocument
extends XmlParentNode

Represents the entire XML document.

Author:
K.A., copyright (c) 2008

getXmlDeclaration

public XmlDeclaration getXmlDeclaration()
Returns the XML declaration of this document.

Returns:
the XML declaration of this document or null, if it does not have one.
Since:

getDoctype

public XmlDocumentType getDoctype()
Returns the type of this document.

Returns:
either the doctype or null, if this document has no DTD associated with it.

getDocumentElement

public XmlElement getDocumentElement()
Returns the root element of this document.

Returns:
the root element of this document or null, if this document has no elements.

getElementsByTagName

public XmlNodeList getElementsByTagName(java.lang.String tagName)
Returns a node list containing all the elements with the specified tag name as they appear in this document.

Parameters:
tagName - the tag name to match. The special value "*" matches all tags.
Returns:
a possibly empty node list containing the elements that matched.
See Also:
XmlElement.getElementsByTagName(java.lang.String)

getElementById

public XmlElement getElementById(java.lang.String id)
Returns the element that has an ID-attribute with the specified value.

Note that a validating parser would be able to identify an ID-attribute based on the DTD. This implementation just checks for an attribute named "id" or (the XML-standard) "xml:id".

Parameters:
id - the value to match.
Returns:
the element with the specified ID-attribute or null, if no matching element was found.
Since:
DOM Level 2
See Also:
XmlAttribute.isId()

getElementsByAttribute

public XmlNodeList getElementsByAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.String value)
(non-DOM) Returns a node list containing those elements located in this document that have an attribute with the specified name and value.

Parameters:
name - the attribute name to match.
value - the attribute value to match. The special value "*" matches all values for that specific attribute.
Returns:
a possibly empty node list containing the elements that matched.

trimElementContentWhitespace

public void trimElementContentWhitespace()
(non-DOM) Removes all element content whitespace from the document tree.

See Also:
XmlElement.trimElementContentWhitespace(), XmlText.isElementContentWhitespace()

insertBefore

public XmlNode insertBefore(XmlNode newChild,
                            XmlNode refChild)
Description copied from class: XmlNode
Inserts a new node immediately before the reference node into the list of children of this node. If the reference node is null, the new node will be appended to the end of the list.

Overrides:
insertBefore in class XmlParentNode
Parameters:
newChild - the node to be inserted.
refChild - the node to insert before, if non-null; otherwise the new child will be appended to the end of the list of children of this node.
Returns:
the node inserted.
See Also:
XmlNode.appendChild(proj78.xml.XmlNode)

importNode

public XmlNode importNode(XmlNode node,
                          boolean deep)
Imports a node from another document into this one.

Parameters:
node - the node being imported.
deep - indicates whether to recursively import the subtree underneath the specified node (i.e., perform a deep clone).
Returns:
the imported node.
Throws:
XmlException - NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: if the operation is not supported for the type of node being imported.
Since:
DOM Level 2
See Also:
XmlNode.cloneNode(boolean)

Description copied from class: XmlNode
Returns either a shallow or a deep copy of this node.

Specified by:
cloneNode in class XmlNode
Parameters:
deep - indicates whether the child nodes are also to be duplicated.
Returns:
either a shallow (i.e., childless) or deep copy of this node.
